Clubs and Activities
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
Bang for the buck
What to do for fun

Dorm Life
Academic Rigor
Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments
Campus security is always on call when you need them. There are also safe spots all around campus if someone feels as if they are in danger, they can easily click a button for help!
The sororities and fraternities on campus will welcome any new member into their family and treat them as such!
There are always activities going on at IUP and there are endless amounts of clubs! You'll never get bored!
Walking through the oak grove with friends when the weather is nice!
College tuition is affordable and the financial aid office is eager to help anyone with questions!
When I'm not in class or doing homework I like to hang out with friends that I've made on campus!

There are many different types of dining options available at IUP. With the easy-to-use flex and meal plan swipes, it makes dining more enjoyable! There are also many different restaurants off-campus as well if you feel like spending a night out on the town!

The dorms at IUP are beautiful. They have many different styles of dorms to accommodate anyone's needs. The CA's are friendly and always available to assist when needed. The dorms make students feel safe with the type of security used.
IUP places students in classes that they are able to pass if the student puts forth the work and effort. Anything is possible if you put your mind to it!
Students, I know all of the many activities you want to participate in, on and off campus both seem more appealing than school work at times, but get your work done first!

IUP is a larger college where a student is not just a number. Academics is very important, but once all your work is done there are many activities to participate in; there is always something going on! Lastly, IUP is college that provides students with future opportunities after college, like internships, job opportunities, and many more!
pageTitle: Indiana University of Pennsylvania (IUP) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {632415=It's affordable. That said, you may have to take out loans if you do not get sufficient financial aid (this happens especially if you live in on-campus housing). My loans have averaged $1000 per semester. Also, the quality of education will depend on the department/major you are in. The Education department and Nursing programs have notable and excellent programs, while some others are very lacking in terms of instructor quality and rigor., 700862=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 10966=Expect cold weather in October, but mostly expect amazing unity. The IUP campus is big and holds 14,000 students, but you feel so involved when you are here. Whether you join the paper or just play frisbee with friends in the Oak Grove, you will see how unified the students are.}

textAfterTable: Great for these types of students Great for all types of students, especially education majors! Bang for the buck It's cheap compared to other schools in Pennsylvania. What to do for fun You could go hang out at Indiana Mall or Walmart. There are also some interesting stores along with the Jimmy Stewart Museum on Philadelphia Street in downtown Indiana. Food and Dining The quality of the food depends on where you go. Fosters Dining Hall's food isn't so great, but it is buffet style. The HUB (our student union) has a make-your-own pasta and salad places along with a hamburger place, Chick-Fil-A, and a sandwich shop. Folgers Dining Hall has a pizza place, a wrap station, oriental food, home foods, Quiznos, and Starbucks. You can used meal swipes at most places and flex to cover the rest. Dorm Life The suites are brand new! You can have your own bedroom, the kitchens are furnished with a microwave and mini-fridge, and you have a bathroom located in your suite. You are spoiled at IUP as far as dorming goes. Academic Rigor
